video.title: Maths for Programmers: Sets (Here Is A Non-Rational Number)
video.description:
We're busy people who learn to code, then practice by building projects for nonprofits. Learn Full-stack JavaScript, build a portfolio, and get great references with our open source community.

Join our community at https://freecodecamp.com
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/freecodecamp
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/freecodecamp
Follow Quincy on Quora: https://www.quora.com/Quincy-Larson

topLevelComment.author: c l
topLevelComment.text: if a^2 = 2 * b^2, how did a^2 become 2 * (2 * k^2)?

topLevelComment.author: Aron Tesfay
topLevelComment.text: I don't understand the logic behind concluding that the number is irrational because the 2s reduce in 2k/2l. How does that make  sqrt(2) irrational?

replies.author: Dhaval Makvana
replies.text: the assumption was that a/b is an irreducible fraction, that a and b don't have any factors in common. But here our assumption was wrong.

topLevelComment.author: Wrongderful
topLevelComment.text:
I understand up to the point of a is even, because it is 2 times an integer => even number.

But the part written in red I don't understand. What happens there?

replies.author: John B
replies.text: 2 * 2k^2 is equivalent to the value 4k^2 (not written on the board). Because a^2 is equivalent to 2 * 2k^2, we can break up a^2 into a * a (a  * a is equivalent to a^2). We can then suggest that a = 2k, because a * a is equivalent to 2k * 2k (which is 4k^2, or similarly 2 * 2k^2).

topLevelComment.author: 德坤
topLevelComment.text: Are there plans to introduce Chinese translation?

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: Not currently. You can submit Contributions though: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6054623?hl=en :)
